body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.8.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No

### Operating system/version

EndeavourOS Linux x86_64, 5.19.13-arch1-1

### Terminal name/version

xfce4-terminal

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

appimage

### How to reproduce the issue

1. Create config file (called in this example 'cmdheight-init.lua') with the following content:
```lua
vim.o.cmdheight = 0
vim.keymap.set('n', '<M-m>', '<Cmd>lua print("Hello")<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '<M-n>', function() print("Hello") end)
```
2. Execute `nvim --clean -u cmdheight-init.lua`.
3. Type `<M-m>`. It prints "Hello" but with hit-enter-prompt.
4. Clear hit-enter-prompt.
5. Type `<M-n>`. It prints "Hello" without hit-enter-prompt.

### Expected behavior

Both mappings result in identical behavior.

### Actual behavior

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24854248/195992096-0184a39d-79c3-41bf-953b-4958338f1eed.mp4

comment_data.body:
Isnt this because the `<M-m>` has two newlines? One from the print statement and one from the `<cr>`?

`<M-n>` only has one newline.
I don't think that `<cr>` prints a new line.

> Isnt this because the `<M-m>` has two newlines? One from the print statement and one from the `<cr>`?
> 
> `<M-n>` only has one newline.

The `<Cmd>...<CR>` approach with `cmdheight=0` is currently equivalent to actually typing `:...<CR>` in terms of hit-enter-prompt. But instead of actually typed command it prints empty strings as first line. I don't it should be the case, because it greatly complicates writing backwards compatible code (for Neovim<0.7).
It might be related to #20380.

It is fixed by #20548.

So it is the dup of #20380.

> It is fixed by #20548.
> 
> So it is the dup of #20380.

@Shougo, I just tried #20548 and it is indeed an improvement, but there are issues still. Some of them are very hard to reproduce issues...

First one which I was able to reproduce is about difference in `echo` between Normal and Visual mode mappings. I does echo in Normal mode, but not in Visual. Here is a config:

```lua
vim.o.cmdheight = 0

vim.keymap.set('n', '<M-m>', '<Cmd>echomsg "Hello"<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('x', '<M-m>', '<Cmd>echomsg "Hello"<CR>')
```

Here are demos in current stable (0.8.0) and built from #20548:

<details><summary> Demos of Normal-Visual issue </summary>

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24854248/196222521-8235413f-caf5-4e23-bd12-16655be67d85.mp4

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24854248/196222542-1eada9c3-61e5-4460-912d-430411363176.mp4

</details>

The other one I am not able to reproduce without dependency. It requires [mini.nvim](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim) installed in some 'pack/**/opt' path. Specifically, certain message in 'mini.ai' has same symptoms in stable version (work with `cmdheight=1` but results in hit-enter-prompt with `cmdheight=0`), but different in your PR (shows empty line, presumably first one from stable version).

<details><summary> Demos of 'mini.ai' </summary>

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24854248/196223794-43d63eed-7651-4593-a5f4-8170ed67ef14.mp4

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24854248/196223819-8926d913-031a-4611-b9b0-e63cc87f281b.mp4

</details>

No matter how hard I tried I couldn't narrow it down to a simpler  example, sorry. Could you also help me here? If it is of any help, whole source code of module is [here](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/main/lua/mini/ai.lua), relevant bit producing message is [this one](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/1a911c2e710b6b3a4b673ab2f47911faa06f5286/lua/mini/ai.lua#L539-L549).

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/20673#issuecomment-1281093803

Reproduced.

But https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/20673#issuecomment-1281095405

It is too long.  Please upload the reproduce-able instructions.
I don't want to see the screen record to reproduce the problem.

> No matter how hard I tried I couldn't narrow it down to a simpler example, sorry. Could you also help me [here](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/main/lua/mini/ai.lua)? If it is of any help, whole source code of module is here, relevant bit producing message is [this one](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/1a911c2e710b6b3a4b673ab2f47911faa06f5286/lua/mini/ai.lua#L539-L549).

Please help me.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/20673#issuecomment-1281093803

The behavior is same with `cmdheight=1`.
So it is the PR's issue?  I don't think so.
It seems the text is overwritten by `--VISUAL--`.
I have fixed the problem.  Please test the PR again.

> I have fixed the problem. Please test the PR again.

The 9b1c107de commit exits Neovim if there is a print of several lines. Reproducible actions:
- Start with `nvim -u NONE`.
- `:set cmdheight=0`
- `:echomsg "Hello"` followed by `:echomsg "World"`.
- `:messages`. I see Neovim exiting with message `...neovim/src/nvim/message.c:2414: msg_scroll_flush: Assertion `row >= 0' failed.`.

> It is too long. Please upload the reproduce-able instructions.
I don't want to see the screen record to reproduce the problem.

My bad. Here are the steps:
- Install 'mini.nvim' in some 'pack/\*\*/opt' directory. For example, on Unix system:
    - `mkdir -p ~/.config/nvim/pack/test_plugins/opt/mini.nvim`
    - `git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim ~/.config/nvim/pack/test_plugins/opt`
- Create the following Lua init file (named here as 'cmdheight_mini-nvim_init.lua'):
```lua
vim.o.cmdheight = 0

vim.cmd('packadd mini.nvim')
require('mini.ai').setup()
```
- Open Neovim with `nvim -u cmdheight_mini-nvim_init.lua cmdheight_mini-nvim_init.lua`.
- Type `da&`. My observations:
    - In 0.8.0 it will show hit-enter-prompt with empty line followed by lengthy message.
    - If `cmdheight=1`, it will show same message without hit-enter-prompt.
    - With https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/9b1c107de501afe019fb59cc9e25a403080caf0d commit and `cmdheight=0` it will show empty line (presumably the one being first in stable release).
- Same goes for previous step but in Visual mode with `va&` instead of `da&`.

When done with this example, run `rm -r ~/.config/nvim/pack/test_plugins`.

Sorry I can not narrow it down any further, no matter how hard I try.
Reproduced.  It is hard to fix for me...

It seems trade off.

1. Accept `press enter`.
2. Remove `press enter`.  But sometimes not redraw

I cannot fix both problems.

> It seems trade off.
> 
>     1. Accept `press enter`.
> 
>     2. Remove `press enter`.  But sometimes not redraw
> 
> 
> I cannot fix both problems.

In general, I'd understand that completely.

I've seen your comments that `cmdheight=0` works differently and it is hard to dynamically set `cmdheight`. But everything works with `cmdheight=1`, so should it at least in theory be possible to make `cmdheight=0` show last line in 'mini.ai' case? Unless, of course, I am doing something wrong in 'mini.ai' which can be fixed there, but I can't figure out if that is the case.
In current implementation, it does not change `cmdheight` dynamically.

> I am doing something wrong in 'mini.ai' which can be fixed there, but I can't figure out if that is the case.

Hm...  The implementation something wrong.

```lua
H.message = function(msg)
  vim.cmd([[echon '']])
  vim.cmd('redraw')
  vim.cmd('echomsg ' .. vim.inspect('(mini.ai) ' .. msg))
end
```
The `redraw` breaks the behavior.

I think it is better.

```diff
diff --git a/lua/mini/ai.lua b/lua/mini/ai.lua
index 2a83808..9bfeb2d 100644
--- a/lua/mini/ai.lua
+++ b/lua/mini/ai.lua
@@ -1846,8 +1846,10 @@ end
 
 -- Utilities ------------------------------------------------------------------
 H.message = function(msg)
-  vim.cmd([[echon '']])
-  vim.cmd('redraw')
+  if vim.o.cmdheight > 0 then
+    vim.cmd('redraw')
+    vim.cmd([[echo '']])
+  end
   vim.cmd('echomsg ' .. vim.inspect('(mini.ai) ' .. msg))
 end
```

> The `redraw` breaks the behavior.

Confirmed. It still issues hit-enter-prompt on stable 0.8.0, but works without it on https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/9b1c107de501afe019fb59cc9e25a403080caf0d commit. Thanks so much!

If this PR is merged, I am sure many plugin developers would appreciate any tips somewhere about how and when to use redraw with `cmdheight=0`.

Just to be sure, have you seen [this comment](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/20673#issuecomment-1281889072) with segfalut issue?
Please test the latest.

> Please test the latest.

The [dabbdd0](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/20548/commits/dabbdd0ac83327898d68c4adf462e6d91886f416) commit does solve all noticed here issues regarding rendering (both in original comment and in 'mini.ai') but seems to not disable hit-enter-prompt completely.

Steps:
- Create the following Lua config (in this example named 'cmdheight-init.lua'):
```lua
vim.o.cmdheight = 0

vim.keymap.set('n', '<M-m>', '<Cmd>echomsg "Hello"<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('x', '<M-m>', '<Cmd>echomsg "Hello"<CR>')
```
- Open Neovim with `nvim -u cmdheight-init.lua cmdheight-init.lua`.
- Type `<M-m>`. It prints "Hello" without visible hit-enter-prompt but with cursor focused on command line. In case of `cmdheight=1` focus stays in buffer.
- Try one of:
    - Type `<CR>`. Cursor focuses on buffer without movement. In case of `cmdheight=1` it moves down.
    - Type `k`. Cursor does not change focus (and doesn't move if there are lines above in current buffer). In case of `cmdheight=1` it moves up.
    - Type `l`. Everything works as expected (cursor focuses back and moves to right).

Yes.  You cannot disable hit-enter-prompt.
It is trade-offx

> Yes. You cannot disable hit-enter-prompt. It is trade-offx


I must say, in general it feels weird having a hit-enter-prompt with `cmdheight=0` when there is none with `cmdheight=1`. But if you know about it and say nothing further yet can be done, then surely it is enough for me.

Thanks for your continuous great work and `cmdheight=0` enthusiasm!

Which behavior is better?

* No press-enter, but the messages are not displayed sometimes
* Press-enter, all messages are displayed

You can choose the one of them.

Please see this.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/20548#issuecomment-1275136105

I think it is the same problem.

> Which behavior is better?
> 
>     * No press-enter, but the messages are not displayed sometimes
> 
>     * Press-enter, all messages are displayed
> 
> 
> You can choose the one of them.

I am sorry for not being really helpful here, but choosing single one is not enough. My expectations from `cmdheight=0` (and I think not only mine) are that it handles messages in command line the same as `cmdheight=1`. How it shows them (over statusline or inside temporary `cmdheight=1` command line) is another question

From user experience I think having to press extra keys (when you feel you shouldn't) is worse than having not seen a message (when you feel you should).

> Please see this.
> 
> [#20548 (comment)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/20548#issuecomment-1275136105)
> 
> I think it is the same problem.

Yes, it might be.
Also related: #22878 #28562

milestone.title: backlog

title: `cmdheight=0` causes hit-enter-prompt in case of `<Cmd>...<CR>` mapping
